intro: Haronga madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascar haronga, is a unique plant native to the island of Madagascar. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists and horticulturists. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
